intro: Pyrus oligantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its slender, often sparsely branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, edible pears that are not widely cultivated. Pyrus oligantha is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
